I like how John Oliver always looks like he borrowed his dad's sports jacket. @TheDailyShow

Community's incredible Acceptable Episode streak continues!

Also The AV Club is going to introduce a new writer, Poochie, who we think you'll grow to love!

Also, all of your favorite TV Club writers are staying put. Except for @davidlsims. We're spinning him off! To a new city! And new friends!

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) April 26, 2013

When @davidlsims leaves behind TV for a new job as a public policy blogger, he finds out what's REALLY happening. This fall, on SIIIIIIMS!

I imagine this AV Club thing has thus far played out exactly like the Michael Scott Paper Company, and I hope it all works out ultimately.

But who will write about "Parenthood" for the AV Club?!??!?!? #twitterconfusion

Parenthood! Taylor Kinney's face! NBC, making smart renewal decisions.

Last night's #TBBT illustrates why I never recommend #BTVS to my friends because if they don't like it, we can no longer be friends.

#Hannibal's food looks so good that honestly I wouldn't give a shit who it was made out of.

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
I hear Angus T. Jones will be replaced by a pizza place next season.

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) April 26, 2013

There was an unbroken string of 11-season US sitcoms. M*A*S*H overlapped with CHEERS, which lead right into FRASIER. 32 years of excellence.

— Anthony Strand (@ZeppoMarxist) April 27, 2013

Well now FRASIER overlaps with the 11-season hit TWO AND A HALF MEN, so who cares about anything anymore?

— Anthony Strand (@ZeppoMarxist) April 27, 2013

Ashton Kutcher making $700,000 a week is wrong when people are starving. It's wrong even if one person on earth is mildly hungry.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) April 26, 2013

Tim Riggins clearly missed Tami Taylor's memo warning everybody in Dillon to stay away from Ryan Murphy.

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) April 26, 2013

Whenever I don't understand a reference literally everyone else in the world gets, I automatically know it's Simpsons.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) April 26, 2013

Thought that just occured: Thank God Joss Whedon isn't George Lucas. Imagine what the Buffy the Vampire Slayer Special Edition would be.

what if you're the amanda bynes of your friend group?

@TVMcGee Who knows? Get enough alcohol in Harmon and he can probably take on a whole NFL team on his own. It's like spinach and Popeye.
